intro: Psacalium latilobum, commonly known as the broad-lobed psacalium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or red. Its leaves are broad and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks.
